data.enText: done or shared by all members of a group of people; involving a whole group or society

data.chText: 集体领导 / 决策；共同责任

data.enText: collective memory (= things that a group of people or a community know or remember, that are often passed from parents to children)
used to refer to all members of a group
The collective name for mast, boom and sails on a boat is the ‘rig’.
data.chText: 船的桅杆、帆桁和帆总称为“索具”。

data.enText: We have had a successful year, both collectively and individually.
data.chText: 我们这一年干得不错，无论是整体还是个人都取得了成功。

data.enText: rain, snow and hail, collectively known as ‘precipitation’ (= as a group)
data.chText: 总称为“降水”的雨、雪和冰雹

data.enText: a group of people who own a business or a farm and run it together; the business that they run
data.chText: 企业集团；合作农场；集体企业

data.enText: an independent collective making films for television
data.chText: 为电视制作影片的独立集体企业

simple_means.memory_skill: collect v.收集 + -ive 形容词后缀

tr: set up on the principle of collectivism or ownership and production by the workers involved usually under the supervision of a government
done by or characteristic of individuals acting together

example.ex: The country's politicians are already heaving a collective sigh of relief.
example.tran: 该国的政界人士均已松了口气。

value.def: Collective actions, situations, or feelings involve or are shared by every member of a group of people.

example.ex: They collectively decided to recognize the changed situation...
example.tran: 他们集体决定承认形势已经发生改变。

example.ex: The Cabinet is collectively responsible for policy.
Their collective volume wasn't very large.

value.def: A collective amount of something is the total obtained by adding together the amounts that each person or thing in a group has.

example.ex: In 1968 the states collectively spent $2 billion on it.
example.tran: 1968年，各州在这上面总共花费了20亿美元。

example.ex: Social science is a collective name, covering a series of individual sciences.
example.tran: 社会科学是一个统称，涵盖一系列的独立学科。

value.def: The collective term for two or more types of thing is a general word or expression which refers to all of them.

example.ex: ...other sorts of cells (known collectively as white corpuscles).
example.tran: 其他类型的细胞(统称为白细胞)

example.ex: He will see that he is participating in all the decisions of the collective.
example.tran: 他会确保自己参与集体企业的各项决策。

value.def: A collective is a business or farm which is run, and often owned, by a group of people who take an equal share of any profits.

trans: 集体行为；集体行动；集群行为；集合行为；集体行动问题
共同所有权；集体所有权
(劳资双方就工资和工作条件进行的)集体谈判
集体合同，集体谈判协议
集体合同（契约），集体协议
集体无意识(普遍存在于人类，成因是遗传)
集体精神；心灵；集体观念
集合名词(如committee或team，在英国英语中既可用单数也可用复数动词；在美国英语中必须用单数动词)

partsOfSpeech.dec: collect v.收集 + -ion 行为,状态
act 行动,做 + -ive 形容词后缀
attract v.引来 + -ive 形容词后缀
creat(e) 创造 + -ive 形容词后缀
expens(e) 费用 + -ive 形容词后缀
relate 联系,关联 + -ive 形容词后缀
pass 走,跨过 + -ive 形容词后缀
ad- 加强 + ject 投掷,扔 + -ive 形容词后缀
aggress vi.攻击 + -ive 形容词后缀
alternate 轮流,(使)交替 + -ive 形容词后缀
at- 加强 + tent 伸展 + -ive 形容词后缀
com- 共同, 一起 + prehend 抓, 抓住 + -ive 形容词后缀
effect n.结果 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + cess 行走,撤退 + -ive 形容词后缀
execut(e) 执行 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + tens 伸展 + -ive 形容词后缀
impress v.使（人）赞赏尊敬 + -ive 形容词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 短时间内集中紧张进行的
partsOfSpeech.dec: intens(e) 高度的,极度的 + -ive 形容词后缀
posit 放 + -ive 形容词后缀
pro- 向前,在前 + duct 引导 + -ive 形容词后缀
progress n.前进 + -ive 形容词后缀
protect v.保护 + -ive 形容词后缀
re- 相对,相反 + spect 看 + -ive 形容词后缀
suc- 在...下面 + cess- 走开;撤退 + -ive 形容词后缀
destruct v.毁坏 + -ive 形容词后缀
co- 共同,一起 + oper- 工作 + -ate 做,造成 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + clus 关闭 + -ive 形容词后缀
con- 共同,一起 + secut 跟随 + -ive 形容词后缀
prospect n.未来事件发生的可能性 + -ive 形容词后缀
in- 在内,进入,使 + clus 关闭 + -ive 形容词后缀
de- 离开,向下 + cis 切,割 + -ive 形容词后缀
initiat(e) 入会 + -ive 形容词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 大量的，巨大的，大规模的
partsOfSpeech.dec: mass 大量 + -ive 形容词后缀
narrat(e) 叙述 + -ive 形容词后缀
in- 在内,进入,使 + cent 唱,歌 + -ive 形容词后缀
subject n.题目 + -ive 形容词后缀
per- 完全 + spect- 看 + -ive 形容词后缀
indicat(e) 指示 + -ive 形容词后缀
